titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, VVORSHIPFVLL AND Others, that are understanding Readers and Impartiall Censurers.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, VVORSHIPFVLL AND Others, that are understanding Readers and Impartiall Censurers.

monogr.title: A funerall elegie, in memory of the rare, famous, and admired poet, Mr. Benjamin Jonson deceased. Who dyed the sixteenth day of August last
monogr.author: Taylor, John

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, VVORSHIPFVLL AND Others, that are understanding Readers and Impartiall Censurers.
div.l: RIght Honour'd, Worshipfull and knowing men,
I doe not here confine my Dedication,
To any one man, but my toyling pen
Writes to great Brittaine, and the Irish Nation,
Know that the subject of My verse is Ben,
And what he was, his workes doe make relation.
Alive his lines abroad by Fame were spread,

l.hi: For which he is belov'd now he is dead.

div.l: Dead, no, he lives, he will, and shall survive,
For Death hath taken but his shell or Rhyn'de,
His better parts are still with us alive,
His Pith or Kernell he hath left behinde,
